value: Sunflower Bank, N.A. (successor to First National Bank and Trust Company of Salina)
explanation: Confirmed from multiple lease amendments and short form lease.
source: Sunflower Bank- Lease Amendment No. 4.pdf; Sunflower Bank- Short Form Lease.PDF

value: 1. Original Lease Agreement dated July 31, 1972; 2. First Amendment to Lease dated September 24, 1973; 3. Second Amendment to Lease dated June 19, 1975; 4. Third Amendment to Lease dated December 23, 1997; 5. Fourth Amendment to Lease dated July 20, 2023; 6. Short Form Lease recorded October 1973.
explanation: List of all known lease documents and amendments forming the complete lease record.

value: Not available
explanation: No guarantor mentioned in any lease or amendment.
Building footprint verified in ALTA survey.

value: Not available
explanation: Lease does not define or allocate a pro rata share for expenses.

value: August 1, 1973 – July 31, 2033 (50-year original term + 10-year extension)
explanation: Original term 1973–2023; extended through 2033 per Fourth Amendment.
source: Sunflower Bank- Short Form Lease.PDF; Sunflower Bank- Lease Amendment No. 4.pdf

title: Rent
explanation: Two rent periods defined in the 2023 amendment extending lease to 2033.

value: 1. Right to Terminate at 20th and 40th anniversaries with 2 years' notice; 2. Removal of Improvements allowed with restoration and bond; 3. Assignment/Subletting allowed with Lessor consent; 4. Indemnification option; 5. Bona Fide Dispute clause; 6. Insurance requirements; 7. Notice provisions.
explanation: Options from original lease; current extension has no additional options.
source: Sunflower Bank- Lease.PDF; Sunflower Bank- Lease Amendment No. 4.pdf

value: Banking purposes, including full-service bank and drive-up operations.
explanation: Permitted use explicitly defined in the lease.

value: Tenant has exclusive right for banking use; landlord prohibited from leasing to competing financial institutions.
explanation: Derived from exclusivity clause protecting tenant’s banking operations.

The percentage rent value is specified in the lease agreement as sixty-two and one-half (62.5) times the fixed annual rent provided for in Section 26(a) of the lease for each of two consecutive lease years.
source: Sunflower Bank- Lease Amendment No. 1.PDF', 'Sunflower Bank- Lease.PDF', 'Lease Agreement'

value: Sixty-two and one-half (62.5) times the fixed annual rent
explanation: Sunflower Bank- Lease.PDF, Lease Agreement
source: Section 26(a) of the original lease specifies that percentage rent applies when net retail (gross) sales exceed an amount equal to sixty-two and one-half (62.5) times the fixed annual rent for two consecutive lease years.

value: Not available
explanation: No clause requiring financial statements was found.

value: Not applicable – ground lease; tenant maintains its own parcel.
explanation: No shared common area cost structure; tenant fully responsible for its site.

value: Tenant pays all property taxes directly.Lessee pays all general taxes during lease term, prorated to rent commencement and end.
explanation: Tax responsibility clearly assigned to tenant.

value: Tenant responsible for all site obligations including rent, taxes, insurance, maintenance, and indemnification of landlord.
explanation: Summarizes key tenant obligations as defined in lease.

value: Tenant responsible for all utilities servicing the premises.
explanation: Standard ground lease utility responsibility.

value: Lessee may remove, replace, or reconstruct improvements on the leased premises with landlord approval under Article XII of the original lease. Additionally, under the Third Amendment (1997), Lessee has the right to relocate its pylon sign to a mutually acceptable location within five (5) years from the date of that amendment.
explanation: The main lease grants the tenant on-site reconstruction rights, while the 1997 amendment specifically grants sign relocation rights.
source: Sunflower Bank- Lease.PDF - Article XII (Removal or Replacement of Improvements)
Sunflower Bank- Lease Amendment No. 3.PDF - Pylon Sign Relocation Clause

value: Either party may terminate only upon destruction or condemnation of the premises. The landlord may also terminate if the tenant defaults and fails to cure within the notice period. No right of termination for convenience is provided.
reason: The original lease limits termination to events of default or destruction/condemnation. The Fourth Amendment reaffirms default remedies but does not introduce any termination-for-convenience clause.

value: Not available
explanation: No recapture or go-dark provisions identified.

value: Not available
explanation: Lease does not include co-tenancy language.

value: Lessor covenants that it shall not lease or permit any portion of the premises for use as a bank, mortgage or loan association, or similar institution without prior written approval of the Lessee, except for a savings and loan branch with a floor limit of 1,000 sq ft.
explanation: This clause prevents competing financial institutions from operating within the same shopping center, effectively serving as a radius restriction for banking operations.

value: Tenant executed an estoppel affidavit as part of the 1997 amendment.
explanation: Confirmed in Third Amendment to Lease.

value: No security deposit required or mentioned.
explanation: Confirmed absence across all lease documents.
